content:
Hi! I've been lurking for a while and I have some questions:

  • Is it rude to invite myself to zoom conferences? I almost joined one earlier but chickened out :cold_sweat:
  • I noticed something potentially odd about the documentation and I was wondering if it was a bug. To that end, I was wondering:
    • RE: documentation, should setting the Auto-hide item methods' documentation setting to true hide the method documentation on, say, the String page?
    • How can I build just the rust documentation locally?
  • Finally, is there a documentation stream here? I feel like that's probably where I could contribute the most to Rust at the moment!

I know it's a long message, but thanks!

Welcome @Brian Kung ! You should definitely come on over to the newly created Learning working group stream where we are organizing efforts to improve documentation and make learning about the compiler easier
Messed up the link, but oh well: it's t-compiler/wg-learning
I'm having trouble clicking that link, but is it #t-compiler/wg-learning ? I'll repost there, thanks!

:wave:

Is it rude to invite myself to zoom conferences? I almost joined one earlier but chickened out :cold_sweat:

Not at all! You can turn of your mic and webcam if you're afraid to bother others. Feel free to ask questions also (though it might be better to ask questions separately on Zulip, to avoid holding up the conversation too much if you have many questions)
